title: OpenType Family naming
content:
Hi all,

I’m sure this topic has been covered before, but the typophile search field isn’t working for me, don’t know if it’s the browser or the site but any search returns ’Your search yielded no results.’.

Anyway I have 8 Opentype Fonts that I want to name so they appear as a family in application menus

Duckhill Light  
Duckhill Light Italic

Duckhill Regular  
Duckhill Regular Italic

Duckhill Medium  
Duckhill Medium Italic

Duckhill Bold  
Duckhill Bold Italic

I have ’Learn fontlab fast, Leslie Cabarge’, which explains this subject, but I still carn’t get it to work. In applications like Indesign and Illustrator CS, I get random results were some of the fonts are avaiable and some aren’t.

I have also followed the tutorial at  
 [http://groups.msn.com/fontlab/tipsandtricks.msnw?action=get\_message&mvie...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080212060058/http:/groups.msn.com/fontlab/tipsandtricks.msnw?action=get_message&mview=0&ID_Message=2843 "http://groups.msn.com/fontlab/tipsandtricks.msnw?action=get\_message&mview=0&ID\_Message=2843")

I’m using OSX with FL 4.5 and Siutcase X1 to activate the fonts.  
Could someone please help with an expalination or tutorial.

Much appreicated.

c.

author: coop

comments.content: If you have InDesign and Illustrator CS, you’re bound to have Minion Pro and other large Adobe type families. Open the OpenType files in FontLab and follow the same naming conventions — just substitute the name of your face where appropriate. Works like a charm.
Also, take out spaces in the names between Medium and Italic; some of these programs see those names as identical, and if the style name is MediumItalic, it shows up as unique.

Thanks for the replys guys.

Erik - I dont have Minion Pro, should it come with the InDesign or Illustrator files ?

crossgrove - I’ve tried all different combination of spaces and no spaces, but still no luck.
